abstract: Ohio has slowly lost its status as country's electoral bellwether and is no longer viewed as critical voting bloc for candidates in 2016 presidential election; jarring change is in part due to static population in state, which has remained more or less same for past 40 years and reflects little of  racial and age diversity across rest of United States.
lead_paragraph: It is a jarring change for Ohio’s political veterans, who have long relished having their state at the center of the country’s presidential races.
snippet: It is a jarring change for Ohio’s political veterans, who have long relished having their state at the center of the country’s presidential races....

headline.main: Ohio, Long a Bellwether, Is Fading on the Electoral Map
headline.print_headline: Ohio Has Lost Its Spotlight in Campaign
